column4: kicker, I am losing the plot here. The problem is, I do not receive any upgrades since upgrading to Edgy
but you still get the icon that there are updates available ?
negative
is it running
as in a background process?
there is a program called "update-notifier" active, that's the one right?
yes, adept_notifier
no haven't got that one
maybe that's because I'm on Kubuntu, tried "sudo apt-get update " ?
yes I did.. it hits a lot of lists but it doesn't install anything
it is not supposed to install anything, but it should make the notifier aware of new updates....
and then I run update-manager?
well, I use adept-notifier, which I just click
well only two packages are shown. And those are grey
sorry , you've lost me
the update-manager (or adept-manager for that matter) shows only two packages that are available for updating. And I can't click to install those, because they are greyed out
isn't there an "apply updates" button  ?
did you run it as root ( with kdesu, or gnome equivalent ) ?
affirmative
then I don't have a clue why it's greeyed out :/
ok thanks anyway
